definitions.definition: A silent person; a person who does not talk.
A figure of a person or animal used by a ventriloquist; a puppet.
Something constructed with the size and form of a human, to be used in place of a person.
definitions.example: To understand the effects of the accident, we dropped a dummy from the rooftop.

definitions.definition: A person who is the mere tool of another; a man of straw.
A deliberately nonfunctional device or tool used in place of a functional one.
definitions.example: The hammer and drill in the display are dummies.

definitions.definition: A "dummy teat"; a plastic or rubber teat used to soothe or comfort a baby; a pacifier.
A player whose hand is shown and is to be played from by another player.
A word serving only to make a construction grammatical.
definitions.example: The pronoun "it" in "It's a mystery why this happened" is a dummy.
If flag1 is false, the other parameters are dummies.

definitions.definition: A feigned pass or kick or play in order to deceive an opponent.
A bodily gesture meant to fool an opposing player; a feint.
To make a mock-up or prototype version of something, without some or all off its intended functionality.
definitions.example: The carpenters dummied some props for the rehearsals.
